title: Paranormal Investigation Tours Guide
content:
Paranormal investigation tours are often misunderstood. People imagine a haunted house with blinking lights and manufactured scares. In reality, a proper investigation tour is slower, quieter, and far more methodical than a standard ghost walk. My first investigation tour reset my expectations completely. Instead of being told what to feel, I was taught how to observe—and when to doubt what I was seeing.

How are investigation tours different from regular ghost tours?

Paranormal investigation tours focus on process rather than performance. While regular walking ghost tours emphasize storytelling and history, investigation tours teach participants how investigators attempt to document unexplained phenomena. You'll spend more time standing still, monitoring environments, and learning why certain locations are tested. The tone is calmer and more technical, often resembling a workshop conducted inside a historic site rather than a theatrical experience.

What equipment will you use?

Most investigation tours provide basic tools used by field investigators. Common equipment includes EMF meters, digital voice recorders for EVP sessions, infrared thermometers, and motion-triggered cameras. For a detailed breakdown, see our ghost hunting equipment guide. Guides usually explain what each device measures and what can cause false readings. On my first tour, the most valuable lesson wasn't capturing anything unusual—it was learning how easily environmental factors can influence equipment.

What happens during an investigation?

Investigations usually follow a structured sequence. The guide explains the site's history, establishes baseline environmental readings, and then leads controlled sessions where variables are minimized. Participants may rotate between stations, monitor specific rooms, or observe quietly while equipment runs. Long periods of silence are common. This is deliberate—background noise contaminates data quickly. The most intense moments are often subtle, like temperature shifts or unexplained sounds that require careful evaluation rather than immediate conclusions. Skeptics often appreciate this methodical approach.

Do you need prior experience?

No prior experience is required. Reputable investigation tours are designed for beginners and assume no technical background. What matters more than experience is mindset. Patience, skepticism, and willingness to follow instructions lead to better results than enthusiasm alone. The best guides encourage questions and actively explain alternative explanations for readings.

Where can you do investigation tours?

Investigation tours are typically offered in locations with controlled access, such as historic buildings, underground vaults, or preserved estates. Cities like Edinburgh and New Orleans are well known for these experiences due to the availability of historic sites and experienced investigative guides. Savannah also offers excellent investigation opportunities.

How much do investigation tours cost?

Paranormal investigation tours usually cost more than standard ghost tours because of limited group sizes, longer durations, and equipment use. Most range from $60 to $120 per person, depending on location, site exclusivity, and length of the investigation. Private investigations and overnight sessions cost more.

Investigation tours vs other formats

Not sure if investigation tours are right for you? Consider these alternatives:
  • Prefer storytelling over equipment? Try walking ghost tours
  • Want to combine ghosts with drinks? Pub crawl ghost tours offer a social alternative
  • Interested in historic graveyards? Cemetery tours focus on burial grounds
  • Bringing children? See our guide to ghost tours with kids for age-appropriate options

What to wear and bring

Investigation tours involve long periods of standing and often take place in unheated historic buildings. See our what to wear on a ghost tour guide for practical advice. If you're hoping to capture evidence, review our ghost photography tips before attending.

Practical Takeaway

Paranormal investigation tours are best for travelers who value learning over spectacle. They won't guarantee evidence, but they will teach you how investigators think, test, and question what they encounter. For broader tour context, start with the complete ghost tour guide.
